people.name: Willow Rosenberg
catchPhrase: Bored now.
Oh my god.
That'll put marzipan in your pie plate, bingo.

appearance.distinctive_features: Red hair, freckles

people.backstory: Willow grew up in Sunnydale and was a shy and introverted child. She discovered her powers as a witch in high school and became a key member of the Scooby Gang. She later became romantically involved with Tara Maclay, and the two of them became a powerful magical duo. Willow's addiction to magic led to a dark turn, but she eventually overcame it and continued to use her powers to help her friends and fight evil.
people.notes: Willow's magical abilities and technological expertise have saved the Scooby Gang on numerous occasions. Her relationship with Tara was groundbreaking for TV at the time and remains a beloved aspect of the show. Her struggle with addiction and subsequent redemption arc is considered one of the most powerful and impactful storylines in the Buffyverse.

people.name: Buffy Summers
catchPhrase: I may be dead, but I'm still pretty.
If the apocalypse comes, beep me.
What's the sitch?
abilities: Enhanced strength, speed, agility, and reflexes

people.name: Alexander Harris
catchPhrase: I laugh in the face of danger, then I hide until it goes away.
Sarcasm is my only defense.
I don't like vampires. I'm gonna take a stand and say they're not good.
abilities: Ability to think on his feet
Has a keen sense of humor

appearance.distinctive_features: Eye patch (briefly)

strengths: Ability to think outside the box

people.backstory: Xander grew up in Sunnydale and attended Sunnydale High with Buffy, Willow, and Cordelia. He was initially a social outcast but eventually became an integral member of the Scooby Gang. Despite not having any special abilities, Xander has consistently proven himself to be a valuable member of the team, using his resourcefulness, bravery, and humor to aid in their battles against evil.
people.notes: Xander's relationship with Anya was complex and ultimately tragic, but it was an important part of his character arc. He has a great sense of humor and often provides comic relief in tense situations, but he can also be surprisingly insightful and sensitive. His bravery and loyalty have saved the lives of his friends on numerous occasions.

people.name: Rupert Giles
catchPhrase: The Earth is definitely doomed.
Do you like my mask? Isn't it pretty? It raises the dead.
I'm not sure I like your tone.

appearance.distinctive_features: Reading glasses

strengths: Ability to stay calm under pressure
Loyal and protective of his charges
weaknesses: Can be overly cautious at times
Has a tendency to become emotionally involved with his charges

people.backstory: Giles was born in England and was trained as a Watcher by the Watcher's Council. He was assigned to be the Watcher of Buffy Summers and moved to Sunnydale, where he became a father figure to her and her friends. Giles has a dark past as a rebellious youth and former member of a dark magic cult known as the Eyghon Circle, which he later broke away from and became a Watcher.
people.notes: Giles' relationship with Buffy was one of the most important and poignant relationships in the Buffyverse. He was a constant source of guidance and support for her throughout her journey as the Slayer, and his departure from Sunnydale in Season 6 was a major turning point for the series.

people.name: William the Bloody
catchPhrase: Out for a walk... bitch.
I may be love's bitch, but at least I'm man enough to admit it.
Oh, poor Watcher. Did your life pass before your eyes? 'Cuppa tea, cuppa tea, almost got shagged, cuppa tea...'

appearance.distinctive_features: Platinum blonde hair, British accent

people.backstory: Spike was originally a human named William the Bloody, who was turned into a vampire in 1880. He was known for his love of killing and torture, and gained notoriety as one of the most vicious vampires in history. Spike became an ally of Buffy and the Scooby Gang, and developed a romantic interest in Buffy. He struggled with his obsession with Buffy, and eventually sacrificed himself to save the world in the series finale.
people.notes: Spike was one of the most complex and beloved characters in the Buffyverse, known for his witty one-liners, his intense and often tumultuous relationship with Buffy, and his redemption arc. He was initially introduced as a villain, but eventually became a fan favorite and a central character in the series.

people.name: Liam
catchPhrase: I'm a vampire. I know something about evil. You're not evil.
If nothing we do matters, then all that matters is what we do.
We live as though the world were as it should be, to show it what it can be.

appearance.distinctive_features: Fangs (in vampire form)

weaknesses: His guilt over his past as a vampire

people.backstory: Angel was born as Liam in 1727 in Ireland, and was turned into a vampire in 1753 by Darla. He gained notoriety as one of the most vicious vampires in history, earning the title 'The Scourge of Europe.' He was cursed with a soul in 1898 by a group of Romani people seeking revenge for his murder of one of their own. The curse restored his conscience and gave him a chance at redemption. He eventually became an ally of Buffy and the Scooby Gang, and later moved to Los Angeles to start his own detective agency.
people.notes: Angel was a fan-favorite character known for his brooding personality, his intense love for Buffy, and his struggle to atone for his past as a vampire. He was one of the few characters to receive his own spin-off series, Angel, which aired for five seasons.

people.name: Cordelia Chase
people.occupation: Actress, high school student, demon hunter, secretary, member of Angel Investigations
catchPhrase: God! What is your childhood trauma?
I'm an icon. You worship me.
It's a good thing I have a strong stomach.
abilities: Immunity to certain forms of magic

appearance.distinctive_features: Freckles, beauty mark

weaknesses: Her insecurities and fear of vulnerability

people.backstory: Cordelia was born in Sunnydale and attended Sunnydale High School, where she was popular and often snobbish. She became involved with Buffy and the Scooby Gang after encountering various supernatural threats. In Los Angeles, she became involved with Angel and Doyle in demon-hunting, and eventually joined Angel Investigations. After suffering various personal and professional setbacks, she eventually died and was reborn as a higher being.
people.notes: Cordelia was initially portrayed as a shallow and self-centered character, but gradually developed into a more complex and sympathetic character as the series progressed. She was known for her acerbic wit and her ability to cut through the BS.

people.name: Anya Jenkins
people.occupation: Vengeance demon, member of the Scooby Gang, co-owner of the Magic Box
catchPhrase: I have finesse! I have finesse coming out of my bottom!
I'm just trying to be helpful. I'm sorry if I annoyed you with my friendship.
I'll never tell.
abilities: Immunity to most forms of harm

appearance.distinctive_features: None

weaknesses: Her limited understanding of human emotions

people.backstory: Anya was originally a vengeance demon who specialized in granting wishes for women who had been wronged by men. She was forced to become human by the Scooby Gang, but eventually became a valued member of the group. She had a tumultuous relationship with Xander, which ended when he left her at the altar. She was killed in battle during the final battle against the First Evil.
people.notes: Anya was known for her sharp tongue and her blunt approach to life. She often made inappropriate or insensitive comments, but was ultimately a loyal friend to the Scooby Gang.

people.name: Daniel Osbourne
catchPhrase: Bored now.
Hello, salty goodness.
I find lentils completely incomprehensible.
abilities: Enhanced senses and physical abilities as a werewolf

appearance.distinctive_features: Tattoo of a wolf on his upper arm

people.backstory: Oz was the guitarist for the band 'Dingoes Ate My Baby' and a member of the Scooby Gang. He was also a werewolf, and struggled with the consequences of his condition. He eventually left Sunnydale to learn more about his werewolf nature and how to control it. He returned briefly to help fight against the First Evil during the final season of Buffy.
people.notes: Oz's departure from Sunnydale was due to the actor, Seth Green, leaving the show to pursue other projects. However, he returned for a guest appearance in the final season. Oz was a popular character among fans, in part due to his laid-back personality and dry sense of humor.

people.name: Tara Maclay
abilities: Sensitivity to magic and supernatural energies

relationships.name: Buffy Summers
relationships.relationship_type: Friend and fellow Scooby Gang member

appearance.distinctive_features: Tara is often seen wearing flowing skirts and dresses, and has a distinctive soft-spoken and gentle demeanor.

weaknesses: Can be easily manipulated by others

people.backstory: Tara was introduced in the fourth season of Buffy the Vampire Slayer as a shy and reserved member of a Wicca group that Willow joined. Tara had grown up in an abusive household and had spent much of her life suppressing her natural abilities as a witch. She and Willow began dating in the fifth season, and their relationship was portrayed as one of the first serious and positive depictions of a lesbian relationship on mainstream television. Tara was tragically killed by a stray bullet in the sixth season, which had a profound impact on Willow and the other characters.
people.notes: Actress Amber Benson portrayed the character throughout her tenure on the show, and also co-wrote several episodes. Tara's death remains one of the most controversial and impactful moments in the Buffyverse.

people.name: Jenny Calendar

appearance.distinctive_features: Jenny is often seen wearing bold and unique jewelry and clothing, reflecting her Technopagan beliefs.

strengths: Expertise in technology and the occult
Calm and level-headed in high-stress situations
weaknesses: Can be overly confident in her abilities
Can be stubborn and unwilling to compromise

people.backstory: Jenny was introduced in the first season of Buffy the Vampire Slayer as a computer science teacher at Sunnydale High School, and later revealed to be a member of the Technopagan community. She had a complicated relationship with Rupert Giles, who initially mistrusted her because of her involvement in the occult. Jenny played a pivotal role in helping the Scooby Gang defeat the demon Angelus, but was tragically killed by him in the second season.
people.notes: Actress Robia LaMorte portrayed the character throughout her tenure on the show. Jenny's death had a significant impact on Giles and the other characters, and her loss was felt throughout the rest of the series.

people.name: Drusilla

appearance.distinctive_features: Drusilla often wears Victorian-era clothing and is known for her ethereal and unpredictable behavior.

weaknesses: Fear of crosses and holy water

people.backstory: Drusilla was once a devout Catholic who was turned into a vampire by Angelus in the late 19th century. She has been insane ever since, often speaking in riddles and talking to invisible beings. Drusilla was romantically involved with both Spike and Angelus and played a prominent role in the Whirlwind, a group of infamous vampires who terrorized Europe in the late 1800s. She eventually followed Spike to Sunnydale, where she resumed her killing spree and became a recurring villain on Buffy the Vampire Slayer.
people.notes: Actress Juliet Landau portrayed the character throughout her tenure on the show. Drusilla was a fan-favorite character known for her eerie demeanor and unpredictable behavior.

people.name: Dawn Summers
abilities: Ability to open portals to other dimensions

appearance.distinctive_features: Dawn is often seen wearing bright colors and has a youthful appearance due to her status as the Key.

people.backstory: Dawn was introduced in season 5 as Buffy's younger sister, but it was later revealed that she was actually the Key, a powerful mystical energy that could be used to open portals between dimensions. Her memories and history were fabricated by a group of monks who turned her into a human form to protect her from a hellgod named Glory. Dawn struggled with her identity and purpose throughout the series but eventually accepted her role as the Key and helped defeat Glory.
people.notes: Actress Michelle Trachtenberg portrayed the character throughout her tenure on the show. Dawn was initially a controversial character among fans, but over time she became a beloved member of the Buffyverse.

people.name: Joyce Summers

appearance.distinctive_features: Joyce was often seen wearing stylish clothing and jewelry.

weaknesses: Naive about the dangers of the supernatural world

people.backstory: Joyce was introduced in the first season as Buffy's mother. She was unaware of the supernatural world and Buffy's role as the Slayer until later in the series. Joyce struggled to understand Buffy's responsibilities and the danger that came with them, but she remained a loving and supportive mother until her untimely death in season 5.
people.notes: Actress Kristine Sutherland portrayed the character throughout her tenure on the show. Joyce's death was a major turning point in the series and had a lasting impact on the characters and the storyline.

people.name: The Master

appearance.distinctive_features: The Master had distinctive facial features, including a pronounced brow ridge and sharp teeth.

people.backstory: The Master was one of the oldest and most powerful vampires in existence, and had been alive for centuries. He was the leader of the Order of Aurelius, a powerful vampire cult, and sought to open the Hellmouth, a gateway to a demon dimension that would allow demons to conquer the world. He was trapped in the Hellmouth after a confrontation with Buffy, but was later resurrected and briefly returned to wreak havoc in Sunnydale once again.
people.notes: Actor Mark Metcalf portrayed The Master in several episodes of Buffy the Vampire Slayer. The character was a primary antagonist in the first season and played a pivotal role in establishing the mythology of the show.

people.name: Faith Lehane

appearance.distinctive_features: Faith had a tattoo on her upper arm and wore a leather jacket and combat boots.

people.backstory: Faith was called as a Slayer after Buffy Summers, and initially came to Sunnydale as a replacement Slayer. She had a troubled past and struggled with issues of trust and control. She eventually turned to the dark side and aligned herself with the Mayor, a powerful demon who was planning to ascend and become a pure demon. She was ultimately redeemed after a confrontation with Buffy and has since struggled to come to terms with her past actions.
people.notes: Actress Eliza Dushku portrayed Faith in multiple episodes of Buffy the Vampire Slayer and its spin-off, Angel. The character was a popular and complex addition to the show's mythology, and is often cited as one of the best-written antiheroes in television history.

people.name: Richard Wilkins III

appearance.distinctive_features: The Mayor always wore a suit and had a clean-cut, charming appearance.

people.backstory: Richard Wilkins III was a longtime resident of Sunnydale who had secretly been a demon for centuries. He was the leader of the Order of Aurelius, a cult of vampires who sought to open the Hellmouth and bring about the end of the world. As the Mayor of Sunnydale, Wilkins had access to the town's resources and used his political power to further his goals. He planned to ascend to a higher form of demon during the graduation ceremony at Sunnydale High School, but was ultimately defeated by Buffy and her friends.
people.notes: The Mayor was portrayed by actor Harry Groener and was a popular and memorable villain in Buffy the Vampire Slayer's third season. His polite, grandfatherly demeanor masked his true sadistic nature and made him a unique and compelling antagonist.

people.name: Glory
catchPhrase: Pain is informative.
Did anyone ever tell you you have the cutest little anger?
Did I mention I was a god?

relationships.name: Dawn Summers
relationships.relation: Younger sister and key to the dimensions

appearance.distinctive_features: Glory had a striking appearance and was often seen wearing revealing clothing.

people.backstory: Glory was a powerful Hell-God who was banished from her home dimension and forced to live on Earth. She was searching for a mystical key that would allow her to return home and tried to find it by any means necessary, including killing and torturing innocent people. She was ultimately defeated by Buffy and her friends, who used the key to close the portal to her dimension.
people.notes: Glory was portrayed by actress Clare Kramer and was a memorable villain in Buffy the Vampire Slayer's fifth season. Her over-the-top personality and love of violence made her a formidable opponent for Buffy and her friends.

people.name: Riley Finn

appearance.distinctive_features: Riley was often seen wearing military-style clothing.

people.backstory: Riley Finn was a former member of the US military who was recruited by the Initiative, a secret government organization dedicated to fighting demons. He was sent to Sunnydale to infiltrate Buffy's group of friends and report back to the Initiative. However, he developed feelings for Buffy and eventually left the Initiative to join her in fighting demons. He and Buffy had a tumultuous relationship and eventually broke up when he felt he could no longer handle her dangerous lifestyle.
people.notes: Riley Finn was portrayed by actor Marc Blucas and appeared in Buffy the Vampire Slayer's fourth and fifth seasons. He was initially a controversial character among fans due to his perceived blandness, but has since gained a more positive reputation as a sympathetic and complex character.

people.name: Jonathan Levinson

relationships.name: Warren Mears
relationships.relation: Former friend and partner in crime

relationships.name: Andrew Wells
relationships.relation: Former friend and partner in crime

appearance.distinctive_features: Jonathan wears glasses and is often seen wearing a beanie hat.

people.backstory: Jonathan Levinson was a student at Sunnydale High School and a member of the unpopular crowd. He was frequently bullied and belittled by the popular students, which led him to develop a desire for power and recognition. Along with Warren Mears and Andrew Wells, he formed a trio of aspiring supervillains and engaged in various criminal activities, including attempting to kill Buffy. Jonathan ultimately redeemed himself by sacrificing his life to save the world in the series finale.
people.notes: Jonathan Levinson was portrayed by actor Danny Strong and appeared in multiple episodes throughout Buffy the Vampire Slayer's run. He was a fan-favorite character known for his intelligence, humor, and ultimately tragic fate.

people.name: Warren Mears
people.occupation: Former student, aspiring supervillain, software developer

relationships.name: Jonathan Levinson
relationships.relation: Former friend and partner in crime

relationships.name: Andrew Wells
relationships.relation: Former friend and partner in crime

appearance.distinctive_features: Warren is often seen wearing glasses and dressing in button-up shirts and slacks.

people.backstory: Warren Mears was a student at Sunnydale High School and a member of the unpopular crowd. He was frequently bullied and belittled by the popular students, which led him to develop a desire for power and control. Along with Jonathan Levinson and Andrew Wells, he formed a trio of aspiring supervillains and engaged in various criminal activities, including attempting to kill Buffy. Warren later became a successful software developer but ultimately returned to his villainous ways and was killed by Willow in the series finale.
people.notes: Warren Mears was portrayed by actor Adam Busch and appeared in multiple episodes throughout Buffy the Vampire Slayer's run. He was a controversial character due to his actions and was considered by many fans to be one of the show's most despicable villains.

people.name: Andrew Wells

relationships.name: Jonathan Levinson
relationships.relation: Former friend and partner in crime

relationships.name: Warren Mears
relationships.relation: Former friend and partner in crime

appearance.distinctive_features: Andrew is often seen wearing glasses and dressing in button-up shirts and slacks.

people.backstory: Andrew Wells was a student at Sunnydale High School and a member of the unpopular crowd. He was bullied and belittled by his classmates, which led him to develop a desire for power and control. Along with Jonathan Levinson and Warren Mears, he formed a trio of aspiring supervillains and engaged in various criminal activities, including attempting to kill Buffy. Andrew later became a writer and published a series of novels based on his experiences with the Scooby Gang.
people.notes: Andrew Wells was portrayed by actor Tom Lenk and appeared in multiple episodes throughout Buffy the Vampire Slayer and its spin-off, Angel. He was a recurring character known for his humor and pop culture references, and became a fan favorite despite his earlier villainous actions.

people.name: Amy Madison

appearance.distinctive_features: Amy is often seen wearing dark clothing and makeup.

people.backstory: Amy Madison was a former student at Sunnydale High School and a friend of Willow Rosenberg. She was also a witch who used magic to manipulate others and gain power. After being turned into a rat by her mother, she spent years in rodent form until she was eventually transformed back into a human by Willow. Amy continued to use magic to manipulate and control those around her, and became an enemy of Buffy and the Scooby Gang.
people.notes: Amy Madison was portrayed by actress Elizabeth Anne Allen and appeared in multiple episodes throughout Buffy the Vampire Slayer. She was a recurring character known for her dark and manipulative nature, and for her tumultuous relationship with Willow.

people.name: Darla
people.occupation: Follower of The Master, Acathla, and Wolfram & Hart
abilities: Ability to turn others into vampires

appearance.distinctive_features: Darla often wears period clothing to reflect her old-fashioned nature.

people.backstory: Darla was a 16th-century noblewoman who was turned into a vampire by the Master. She became the sire of Angelus, and the two developed a passionate and sadistic relationship. Darla traveled with Angelus and Drusilla for many years before being staked and killed by Angel. She was later resurrected by Wolfram & Hart, and continued to be a major threat to Buffy and the Scooby Gang.
people.notes: Darla was portrayed by actress Julie Benz and appeared in both Buffy the Vampire Slayer and Angel. She was a recurring character known for her complex relationships with Angel and other vampires, as well as her sadistic and manipulative nature.

people.name: Ben Wilkinson

appearance.distinctive_features: Ben is an average-looking man with no distinctive features.

people.backstory: Ben was a doctor at Sunnydale Hospital who was possessed by the hellgod Glory. As Glory's host, Ben was forced to carry out her bidding, but he secretly loathed the monstrous acts he was compelled to commit. Ben eventually sacrificed himself to prevent Glory's return, knowing that he and Glory were two halves of the same being and that he could not exist without her.
people.notes: Ben Wilkinson was portrayed by actor Charlie Weber and appeared in Season 5 of Buffy the Vampire Slayer. He was a complex character who added a tragic dimension to the season's main villain, Glory.

people.name: Caleb

appearance.distinctive_features: Caleb has a prominent scar across his right eye and cheek, and a tattoo of a cross on his left hand.

people.backstory: Caleb was a preacher who was recruited by the First Evil to serve as its agent. He possessed immense physical strength and a sadistic personality, and enjoyed inflicting pain on women in particular. Caleb became a major adversary for Buffy and the Scooby Gang in the seventh season of Buffy the Vampire Slayer, and ultimately met his demise at the hands of Xander.
people.notes: Caleb was portrayed by actor Nathan Fillion and is known for his distinctive southern accent and unsettling demeanor. His character represents a darker side of religion and underscores the series' themes of misogyny and patriarchal power structures.

people.name: Lorne
abilities: Reading people's future and past by listening to them sing
people.personality: Lorne is flamboyant, fun-loving, and often serves as a comic relief. He is also caring and empathetic, with the ability to sense people's true feelings and intentions. He has a strong sense of loyalty and is willing to risk his life for his friends.
people.first_appearance: Angel season 2, episode 2: "Are You Now or Have You Ever Been"
people.last_appearance: Angel season 5, episode 20: "The Girl in Question"

creation.creator: Maggie Walsh
creation.purpose: To create the ultimate soldier by merging human, demon, and machinery

people.name: Willy
people.description: Willy is a cowardly but savvy demon who runs Willy's Place, a demon bar in Sunnydale. He is known to be a source of information for both humans and demons, but his loyalties always lie with whoever is paying him the most.

people.name: Clem
people.history: Clem was a resident of the demon dimension of Lorne's home world. He moved to Sunnydale and befriended Spike and Buffy's friends. He provided them with information about the demon community and occasionally helped them with their battles against evil. After the end of the Sunnydale Hellmouth, he returned to his home world.
people.notes: Clem's full name is Clement
